quiz.title: Unit 12: AP Microeconomics (Quiz 4)
quiz.subtitle: Factor Markets, Production & Long-Run Adjustments
quiz.subject: AP Microeconomics
quiz.topic: Marginal Product, Isoquants, Cost Curves, Market Efficiency

questions.question: If the firm increases its capital and decreases its labor and produces the same amount of bundt cakes, what happens to the marginal product of capital ($MP_K$) and the marginal product of labor ($MP_L$)?
questions.explanation: When capital increases (holding output constant), the capital-labor ratio rises. More capital per worker means diminishing marginal returns to capital: $MP_K$ falls. Less labor per unit of capital means each remaining worker is more productive: $MP_L$ rises (due to the law of diminishing marginal returns in reverse when a factor becomes relatively scarce).

questions.question: Suppose a firm was interested in how much their revenue would change if they change the price of their good. Which of the following would a firm use to determine how its revenue changes based on the price elasticity of demand?
questions.explanation: The total revenue test examines how total revenue (P × Q) changes when price changes, based on price elasticity of demand: if demand is elastic, price decrease raises TR; if inelastic, price decrease lowers TR. Other options relate to different elasticities or profit, not directly revenue changes from price changes.

questions.question: The nation of Hamsterville has passed a law that from this day forth, nobody shall sell a bowl of gazpacho for more than $10 per bowl. Nobody really cares, however, because the equilibrium price of gazpacho in Hamsterville is $8. What is the term for the price control described above?
questions.explanation: A price ceiling is a legal maximum price. Here the maximum is $10, but the equilibrium is $8, so the ceiling is above equilibrium and has no effect—it's non-binding. A binding ceiling would be below equilibrium and create a shortage.

questions.question: Which of the following is not correct for the perfectly competitive firm, in the long run?
questions.explanation: In long-run perfect competition, firms earn zero economic profit (normal profit) where P = min ATC = MC = MR. P = min AVC is the shutdown point in the short run, not a long-run equilibrium condition.

questions.question: Assume the government establishes a new binding minimum wage. For a typical firm, which of the following will happen to the marginal resource cost (MRC) and the marginal revenue product (MRP) of the last worker hired?
questions.explanation: A binding minimum wage raises MRC (wage). To maximize profit (MRP = MRC), the firm hires fewer workers. With fewer workers, the MRP of the last worker hired is higher due to diminishing marginal returns. Thus, both MRC and MRP increase.
